title: 107_s164
content: The Act may be cited as the "Technology for Teachers Act of 2001". Local applications for school technology resource grants are addressed in the Act. Section 3135 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to require local educational agencies to allocate at least 30 percent of funding for in-service teacher training or technology resources. Section 3135 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to allocate at least 30 percent of total technology funding for in-service teacher training. Subsections (d) and (e) are redesignated as subsections (b) and (c) respectively, with a modification in subsection (c) to replace "subsection (e)" with "subsection (a)". SEC. 3. TEACHER PREPARATION. Part A of title III of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended by adding Subpart 5--Preparing Tomorrow's Teachers To Use Technology. SEC. 3161 outlines the purpose and program authority for this initiative. The purpose of Subpart 5 is to assist consortia in preparing teachers to use technology effectively in classrooms to help students achieve challenging standards. The Secretary can award grants for up to 5 years to develop or redesign teacher preparation programs. "Eligibility for grants under Subpart 5 includes consortia developing teacher preparation programs." Eligible applicants for grants under Subpart 5 must be a consortium including at least one institution of higher education offering a baccalaureate degree for teacher preparation, a State or local educational agency, and other specified entities such as professional associations or for-profit businesses. Eligible applicants for grants under Subpart 5 must be a consortium including an institution of higher education, a State or local educational agency, and other specified entities. To receive an award, applicants must submit a project description that focuses on preparing individuals to use technology for creating inclusive learning environments for all students. The consortium applying for grants must demonstrate commitment and support from all members, describe how each member will be involved, outline plans for project continuation after federal funding ends, and provide a program evaluation plan with benchmarks. Matching requirements for federal cost sharing are also specified. The Federal share of project costs funded under this subpart is limited to 50%, with the non-Federal share allowed in cash or in kind. Up to 10% of funds can be used for equipment acquisition, with the non-Federal share required to be in cash. "SEC. 3163. USE OF FUNDS." A recipient must use funds for creating programs using advanced technology to prepare all students for challenging standards and evaluating project effectiveness. Funds can also be used for developing high-quality teacher preparation programs focused on technology resources. The curr_chunk discusses integrating various technologies into the classroom, evaluating educational technologies, helping students develop technical skills, developing alternative teacher development paths, creating performance-based standards for teachers' technology use, providing technical assistance to teacher preparation programs, and disseminating resources. The curr_chunk focuses on assisting institutions of higher education in preparing teachers to effectively use technology in classrooms by developing resources, acquiring equipment, networking capabilities, and infrastructure for projects. Authorization of appropriations of $150,000,000 for fiscal year 2002 and necessary sums for the following 4 years to support higher education institutions in technology integration for teacher preparation.
